1.text: Turn back, O Israel, unto Jehovah thy God, For thou hast stumbled by thine iniquity.

2.text: Take with you words, and turn to Jehovah, Say ye unto Him: ‘Take away all iniquity, and give good, And we do render the fruit of our lips.

3.text: Asshur doth not save us, on a horse we ride not, Nor do we say any more, Our God, to the work of our hands, For in Thee find mercy doth the fatherless.’

4.text: I heal their backsliding, I love them freely, For turned back hath Mine anger from him.

5.text: I am as dew to Israel, he flourisheth as a lily, And he striketh forth his roots as Lebanon.

6.text: Go on do his sucklings, And his beauty is as an olive, And he hath fragrance as Lebanon.

7.text: Return do the dwellers under his shadow, They revive as corn, and flourish as a vine, His memorial is as wine of Lebanon.

8.text: O Ephraim, what to Me any more with idols? I—I afflicted, and I cause him to sing: ‘I am as a green fir-tree,’ From Me is thy fruit found.

9.text: Who is wise, and doth understand these? Prudent, and knoweth them? For upright are the ways of Jehovah, And the righteous go on in them, And the transgressors stumble therein!
